page.title: 02I.C.I.HILLHOUSE,FLEETWOOD
page.content: The I.C.I. Hillhouse Site is 3 miles long and 1.5 miles across at it's widest point. It was originally located here because of the vast deposits of salt. The River Wyre was also used for transport,cleaning and cooling. It employs 1800 workers of which 100_200 are women doing jobs such as colour_matching and cleaning. The rates of pay per annum are Â£4,000 ranging to Â£30,000, and although the I.C.I. is constantly expanding,the number of employees is declining. The final product is plastic, basically of 2 types, P.V.C. and P.T.F.E. This year I.C.I. has made over Â£1 billion profit and is the first British company to do so.
